activities.loc: Branch 1, Calumet County Courthouse, West Entrance

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
943.10(1m)(a) - Burglary-Building or Dwelling

Shall not have contact with J.E.W. (dob: 04/16/1987) or his residence.  No contact means no contact in person, in writing, by phone, computer, through a third person or otherwise, except through the defendant's attorney. 
Shall not leave state of Wisconsin without permission of the Court. 
Shall not apply for a passport while case is pending.

Defendant appears by video from Calumet County Jail
Advised of charges & penalties, 
Defendant is eligible for SPD, 
$5000 Signature Bond ordered
